thread.title: Penny Lancaster and Rod Stewart go incognito on the tube
thread.title_full: Penny Lancaster and Rod Stewart go incognito on the tube

title: Penny Lancaster and Rod Stewart go incognito on the tube
text: Share 163 shares Never without a hint of glamour however, the Loose Women panelist stood out slightly more with her perfectly coiffed hair and chic fluffy coat as she headed out with her husband, to support him at his gig later on. Informing fans of their journey, she captioned the shot teasingly: 'Sneaking into London by train today' followed by a wink emoji. 'From the overground to the Underground!': Clearly excited by the adventure, Penny then uploaded a second snap of cheeky Rod on the Central Line tube (above) Clearly excited by the adventure, Penny then uploaded a second snap of Rod on the Central Line tube. Pulling his hood further across his face, the Grammy-award winner flashed a cheeky smile at his fellow passengers in the shot, which the model captioned: 'From the overground to the Underground!!' The pair were heading over to the O2 Arena for Rod's final performance of his tour in London. The rocker had taken to the stage on Sunday as well as Monday, for two rearranged concerts following a throat infection in November, which left him unable to perform for two nights. Final time: The pair were heading to Rod's rescheduled tour performance in London, after pulling out due to throat infection in November (pictured in Glasgow) Monday's show marks his last performance until June - where he will perform two exclusive shows in Shrewsbury and Durham, before heading to the Isle of Wight Festival for a headline set. The playful outing comes after Penny, who has been married to Rod since 2007, recently admitted her husband is more demanding than their young sons Alistair, 11, and Aiden, five. She revealed the singing superstar needs to be showered with attention after stepping off the stage in front of his adoring fans, in an interview with the Sunday People . Boys will be boys: The outing comes after Penny, who has been married to Rod since 2007, recently admitted he is more demanding than their sons Alistair, 11, and Aiden, five (above) Penny said: 'Rod has always been like my third child and my most demanding boy out of the three. When Rod is always on tour, in hotel rooms, and after the euphoria of a show, with millions of fans screaming "I love you"... 'He comes home and then he's just Dad, he's not Sir Rod Stewart any more. It must be a bump back to earth, so he requires a lot of my attention.' The pair are celebrating their tenth wedding anniversary this year and will mark the occasion by renewing their wedding vows in Italy, surrounded by family and friends. The milestone will be extra special as their youngest son wasn't born when they first tied the knot, so will be attendance at this second ceremony. Stronger than ever: The pair are celebrating their tenth wedding anniversary this year and will mark the occasion by renewing their wedding vows in Italy, surrounded by family and friends
